newsitem.title: USA: Clinton calls Kohl to discuss Iraq action.
newsitem.headline: Clinton calls Kohl to discuss Iraq action.

text.p: U.S. President Bill Clinton spoke with German Chancellor Helmut Kohl on Wednesday and received German support for this week's U.S. missile strikes against Iraq, a White House spokesman said.
"Chancellor Kohl reiterated of course his appreciation for the United States taking a leadership position on this and moving forward decisively," spokesman David Johnson said.
The United States launched cruise missile strikes against southern Iraq on Tuesday and Wednesday in retaliation for Iraqi military attacks against Kurds in the north.
Clinton telephoned Kohl at about 3 p.m. EDT (1900 GMT) and the call lasted half an hour, Johnson told reporters.
The two leaders also discussed Kohl's upcoming meeting with Russian President Boris Yeltsin in Moscow on Saturday and Russia's relationship with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
"There was not any policy changes, it was just a discussion of how to keep moving forward on the NATO expansion issue," Johnson said of the Clinton-Kohl conversation.
Russia and NATO have been at loggerheads over the alliance's plans to bring former Soviet Bloc countries under its wing.
